description:
## Overview
[github.com/grafana/grafana/pkg/tsdb/mysql](https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/grafana/grafana/pkg/tsdb/mysql?tab=doc) is a tool for beautiful monitoring and metric analytics & dashboards for Graphite, InfluxDB & Prometheus & More.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Arbitrary File Read via MySQL data source. An authenticated attacker that has privileges can modify the data source configurations.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/grafana/grafana/pkg/tsdb/mysql` to version 6.4.4 or higher.
## References
- [Blog Post and PoC](https://swarm.ptsecurity.com/grafana-6-4-3-arbitrary-file-read/)
- [ChangeLog](https://github.com/grafana/grafana/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#644-2019-11-06)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/grafana/grafana/pull/20192)
title: Arbitrary File Read

description:
## Overview
[github.com/oauth2-proxy/oauth2-proxy](https://oauth2-proxy.github.io/oauth2-proxy) is a reverse proxy that provides authentication with Google, Github or other providers.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Open Redirect to an Untrusted Site. Users can provide a redirect address for the proxy to send the authenticated user to at the end of the authentication flow. This is expected to be the original URL that the user was trying to access. This redirect URL is checked within the proxy and validated before redirecting the user to prevent malicious actors providing redirects to potentially harmful sites. However, by crafting a redirect URL with HTML encoded whitespace characters the validation could be bypassed and allow a redirect to any URL provided.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/oauth2-proxy/oauth2-proxy` to version 5.1.1 or higher.
## References
- [GItHub Commit](https://github.com/oauth2-proxy/oauth2-proxy/commit/f5f13481761accdeaacc789fc5ba2be7df1b07ed)
- [GitHub Security Advisory](https://github.com/oauth2-proxy/oauth2-proxy/security/advisories/GHSA-j7px-6hwj-hpjg)
title: Open Redirect to an Untrusted Site

description:
## Overview
[github.com/couchbase/sync_gateway/db](https://github.com/couchbase/sync_gateway) is a horizontally scalable web server that securely manages the access control and synchronization of data between Couchbase Lite and Couchbase Server.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to N1QL injection. An attacker with access to the public REST API can insert additional N1QL statements through the parameters `startkey` and `endkey` of the `_all_docs` endpoint.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/couchbase/sync_gateway/db` to version 2.5 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/couchbase/sync_gateway/commit/97adb5b496aa96aa70398018ea96da913ffd8d8c)
- [Hisolutions Research](https://research.hisolutions.com/2019/06/n1ql-injection-in-couchbase-sync-gateway-cve-2019-9039/)
- [Release Notes](https://docs.couchbase.com/sync-gateway/2.5/release-notes.html)
title: N1QL injection

description:
## Overview
[github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/plugin/pkg/admission/security/podsecuritypolicy](https://godoc.org/github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/plugin/pkg/admission/security/podsecuritypolicy) is a PodSecurityPolicy admission plugin for Kubernetes.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Privilege Escalation resulting in the ability to make use of any existing PodSecurityPolicy object.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/plugin/pkg/admission/security/podsecuritypolicy` to version 1.5.5 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/commit/7fef0a4f6a44ea36f166c39fdade5324eff2dd5e)
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/43459)
title: Privilege Escalation

description:
## Overview
[github.com/uadmin/uadmin](https://github.com/uadmin) is a fully loaded web framework for Golang.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to SQL Injection. Multiple SQL Injection vulnerabilities exist within `uadmin` API handlers.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/uadmin/uadmin` to version 0.5.0 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/uadmin/uadmin/commit/a28a44f966417233bff36f96994f71d3911dddc2)
- [GitHub Release](https://github.com/uadmin/uadmin/releases/tag/v0.5.0)
title: SQL Injection

description:
## Overview
[github.com/nats-io/nats-server/v2/server](https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/nats-io/nats-server/v2/server?tab=doc) is an A simple, secure and performant communications system for digital systems, services and devices.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS). As a user, you can send a publish request which will publish a message to a subject, and all of the clients who are subscribed to the subject will receive the message. The problem is that the go runtime function `make` treats the capacity parameter as an unsigned int so instead of a negative number, it treats it like the number we sent it and then it tries to allocate an abnormal slice and panics.

## Details

Denial of Service (DoS) describes a family of attacks, all aimed at making a system inaccessible to its intended and legitimate users.

Unlike other vulnerabilities, DoS attacks usually do not aim at breaching security. Rather, they are focused on making websites and services unavailable to genuine users resulting in downtime.

One popular Denial of Service vulnerability is DDoS (a Distributed Denial of Service), an attack that attempts to clog network pipes to the system by generating a large volume of traffic from many machines.

When it comes to open source libraries, DoS vulnerabilities allow attackers to trigger such a crash or crippling of the service by using a flaw either in the application code or from the use of open source libraries.

Two common types of DoS vulnerabilities:

* High CPU/Memory Consumption- An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to take a disproportionate amount of time to process. For example, [commons-fileupload:commons-fileupload](SNYK-JAVA-COMMONSFILEUPLOAD-30082).

* Crash - An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to crash. For Example,  [npm `ws` package](https://snyk.io/vuln/npm:ws:20171108)

## Remediation
A fix was pushed into the `master` branch but not yet published.
## References
- [Blog Post](https://www.twistlock.com/labs-blog/finding-dos-vulnerability-nats-go-fuzz-cve-2019-13126/)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/nats-io/nats-server/pull/1441)
title: Denial of Service (DoS)

description:
## Overview
[github.com/go-gorm/gorm](https://github.com/go-gorm/gorm) is an ORM library for Golang.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to SQL Injection in `First` and `Find` arguments.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/go-gorm/gorm` to version 0.2.0 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/go-gorm/gorm/issues/2517)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/go-gorm/gorm/pull/2519)
- [Go-Gorm GitHub Commit](https://github.com/go-gorm/gorm/pull/2519/commits/e3cc5ea4d403078a370e299629da56cd011b6583)
title: SQL Injection

description:
## Overview
[github.com/libopenstorage/openstorage/api/server](https://github.com/libopenstorage/openstorage) is a server package, part of openstorage.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improper Access Control. It is possible for a pvc user to maliciously use the secret located in a namespace they cannot access.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/libopenstorage/openstorage/api/server` to version 3.0.0-beta or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/libopenstorage/openstorage/commit/9db49f2b240222352e82fd4632dd54dbeb37101a)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/libopenstorage/openstorage/pull/1509)
title: Improper Access Control

description:
## Overview
[github.com/concourse/concourse/atc/db](https://github.com/concourse/concourse) is a container-based continuous thing-doer written in Go and Elm.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to SQL Injection. An Concourse resource can craft a version identifier that can carry a SQL injection payload to the Concourse server, allowing the attacker to read privileged data.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/concourse/concourse/atc/db` to version 5.0.1 or higher.
## References
- [Concourse Release Notes](https://github.com/concourse/concourse/blob/master/release-notes/v5.0.1.md#v501-note-1)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/concourse/concourse/commit/dc3d15ab6c3a69890c9985f9c875d4c2949be727)
- [Pivotal Security Advisory](https://pivotal.io/security/cve-2019-3792)
title: SQL Injection

description:
## Overview
[github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/staging/src/k8s.io/apimachinery/pkg/util/proxy](https://godoc.org/k8s.io/apimachinery/pkg/util/proxy) is a package that provides transport and upgrade support for proxies.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Privilege Escalation. Incorrect handling of error responses to proxied upgrade requests in the `kube-apiserver` allowed specially crafted requests to establish a connection through the Kubernetes API server to backend servers, then send arbitrary requests over the same connection directly to the backend, authenticated with the Kubernetes API servers TLS credentials used to establish the backend connection.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/staging/src/k8s.io/apimachinery/pkg/util/proxy` to version 1.10.11, 1.11.5, 1.12.3 or higher.
## References
- [Exploit DB](https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/46053)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/commit/2257c1ecbe3c0cf71dd50b82752ae189c94ec905)
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/71411)
- [Google Forum Report](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/kubernetes-announce/GVllWCg6L88)
title: Privilege Escalation
